message_1:
Solve for the value of x in the equation: 

sin²(x) + cos²(x) = 1 

Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2: This equation is actually an identity in trigonometry, known as the Pythagorean identity. It states that for any angle x, sin²(x) + cos²(x) = 1. This identity is always true, so there is no specific value of x to solve for.
